com.abcjobs.service

Class UserProfileService

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.abcjobs.service.UserProfileService

  • @Service
 @Transactional
public class UserProfileService
extends java.lang.Object
    The Service class for managing user profiles. Provides methods to register new user profiles, retrieve existing user profiles and update user profile information.
    Author:
    Ch'ng Sin Yi

    • Method Detail

      • register

        public UserProfile register(RegistrationDto registrationDto)
                     throws DuplicateEmailException,
                            javax.mail.internet.AddressException,
                            javax.mail.MessagingException
        Registers a new user profile with the given registration data. Throws a DuplicateEmailException if the provided email is already registered. Sends a confirmation email to the registered user upon successful registration.
        Parameters:
        registrationDto - the registration data for the new user profile
        Returns:
        the newly registered user profile
        Throws:
        DuplicateEmailException - if the provided email is already registered
        javax.mail.internet.AddressException - if there is an error with the email address
        javax.mail.MessagingException - if there is an error sending the confirmation email

      • findByProfileId

        public java.util.Optional<UserProfile> findByProfileId(java.lang.Long profileId)
        Finds the user profile with the given profile ID
        Parameters:
        profileId - the ID of the user profile to retrieve
        Returns:
        an Optional containing the user profile with the given ID, or an empty Optional if not found

      • findByUserAccount

        public java.util.Optional<UserProfile> findByUserAccount(UserAccount userAccount)
        Finds the user profile with the given user account ID
        Parameters:
        userAccount - the user account to retrieve
        Returns:
        an Optional containing the user profile with the given user account, or an empty Optional if not found
